alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 8:12PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Ojo Caliente Below La Madera affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Rio Ojo Caliente below La Madera. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Farm and pasture land is being inundated, and irrigation channels and gates may be severly damaged if high flows persist. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 5.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 7.0 feet early Tuesday afternoon. It will rise above flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Action stage is 6.5 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Rio Ojo Caliente La Madera 7.0 5.5 Thu 7 pm MDT 6.1 6.0 6.1 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Friday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
